intro: Penstemon barbatus f. flaviflorus, commonly known as the yellow-flowered beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
